messages.content: :tbh_flat:
in my experience, spyglass has often been a feast or famine relic
if you have concentrate for any reason before finding this relic, you're probably planning on using it
or you don't have any concentrate at all
and other times, you get this and never find any concentrate at all (or at least it's not worth taking the cards that do give it)
I´ve had a similar experience with this relic
What's the common attack that concentrates?
<tracking shot>

embeds.title: Tracking Shot
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

**Concentrate** :p_concentration:.
Deal 9 (12) damage.

messages.content: This turns into that silent card that gives energy next turn
<flying knee>

embeds.title: Flying Knee
embeds.description:
Common Attack / 1 :green_energy: / The Silent / Slay the Spire

Deal 8 (11) damage.
Next turn, gain :green_energy:.

messages.content: with +1 damage
It seems like other people don't like this relic that much, but I like it a lot
whelp
we found it
this is the one thing you really like that others do not
Its quite a bit better than flying knee + 1 damage because It gives the flexibility to use It normally as concentration

Tracking shot, take aim, and snipe+ are the only sources of concentrate for hermit. One of those exhausts and requires an upgrade, and another is a damage common that you don’t want to load up on. This relic is very under supported, and usually won’t help you. You may want to consider grabbing a tracking shot or after you get this, and look for opportunities to play it near the end of turn for the energy next turn. 

If your deck has very few dead-on cards, you can turn a copy of take aim into a very strange imitation of berserk with this. If you are using dead on particularly heavily, or if you don't already have concentrate cards, this will basically be a complete blank. Since there aren't very many sources of concentrate, there is also a reasonable chance that you just don't see any after getting this relic. I don't generally believe that you should be taking tracking shot to enable this if your deck already has enough frontloaded damage.
note that a better card to compare take aim+spyglass to is [[caffeinated]]

embeds.title: Caffeinated
embeds.description:
Rare Power / 1 :colorless_energy: / The Adventurer / The Adventurer

​~~- **Unnate.** -~~
At the start of your turn, gain :colorless_energy:.

messages.content: Yeah this gives you the flexibility to play how you normally would or to not play that dead-on card and save the energy for next turn
Its caffeinated but It takes 1 more turn to start working
so caffeinated with high ping
Well it's not just "gain energy next turn" it's "Concentrate or gain 1 energy next turn"
Also with <take aim>

embeds.title: Take Aim
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.)

messages.content: The main problem is that Im pretty sure It consumes the concentration even If you play the Dead on card from the middle of the hand
If you upgrade it, it's not delayed
It does
True
So, you would have to not play any cards with Dead On for the choice to keep the energy, Spyglass works a lot better with tracking shot than take aim
Also it supplies more options. You aren't just given 1 energy or 1 concentration, it's your choice.
Spyglass takes a bad situation (ending a turn with unused concentration) and makes it a lot better (energy next turn) arguably better than using the concentration
With only 2/3 cards that say "concentrate" Its pretty inconsistent
It's not as consistent, but relics that consistently give high output (such as a whole energy) are usually very strong.
My favorite thing this does is make take aim pickable in decks that arent centered around Dead On
Energy relics are all boss/special relics and have downsides to them.
I rarely center my decks around dead-on, instead taking some as scaling/support
I feel alienated in my like for dead on now
The cards that concentrate arent cards I pick often, so I dont get any value out of this often
Yeah, thats dow I usually play aswell
It doesnt make tracking shot pickable after I already have enough front-loaded damage, so usually It just makes take aim more pickable

This relic is just plain bad. On top of doing nothing unless you have one or more copies of a very few specific cards, it also does nothing unless you forgo the actual benefit you would normally get from concentrate
It doesn't need to do anything every turn, a whole energy is quite a lot
I see this proc infinitely more than I do art of war and I still get happy over seeing art of war
I guess I just know myself and I know my enemy, so I know the outcome of 1000 battles
if it procs twice per combat I would say it's about as good as a lantern
which is pretty darn good
Aka a top 10 common relic
I didn't know that the overall perception of this relic was this bad

I'm a dead on enjoyer
and I think this relic is like alt-Art of War
Alt of War

its not that great. Snipe got nerfed into the ground which leaves hermit lacking many sources of concentration; which are needed for this relic to do anything at all. Take aim is a pretty mediocre power and having this relic doesnt make it much better since if you use the concentrate you don't get the energy; but if you have drafted take aim its because you have dead on cards. So you only get to use that combo if you get take aim afther this relic; which is not likely. Tracking shot is painfully average.
most of the time you get spyglass it does nothing for you; it being to situational makes it feel pretty bad in most games
I wonder how much energy this actually saves per combat? I don't think relic counter works with downfall unfortunately.
the downfall relic stats mod is broken now
a shame
Art of war is also situational, but at least 99% of decks already have non-attack cards in them so you *can* use it.
